text:
COOPER UNION FOR THE ADVANCEMENT
OF SCIENCE AND ART
New York 3, N. Y,
November 2&, 19!?1
Mr, Richard L, Rider* Manager
NAEB Tape Network
University of Illinois
119 Gregory Hall
Urbana, Illinois
Dear Mr« Riders
Dr, Edwin So Burdell, President of Cooper Union, has allowed me to see
copy of your letter of November 20 in respect to the tape recordings of the forum
programs at Cooper Union,
I want to express, on our part, appreciation of the broad distribution
which we achieve through the National Association of Educational Broadcasters«
It is an instance in which the mutuality of our respective cooperations is of
great benefit to both of us.
On behalf of the trustees of Cooper Union, I want to support the thanks
that Dr, Burdell has already expressed to you.
Sincerely yours,
/s/ Gano Dunn
Gano Dunn
Chairman of the Trustees
